name: Tilli
description: Tilli is an AI-powered, play-based Social Emotional Learning tool that builds and measures 8 foundational social emotional learning skills to help kids stay safe, healthy and happy.

sdgs.relevance:
Tilli builds and measures 8 foundational social emotional learning skills in elementary learners, in the process we share actionable data and personalized strategies with caregivers and teachers to help them proactively intervene in a child’s learning and development.

We directly address Indicator 4.2.1 (Ensuring children are developmentally on track), by ensuring children meet their social emotional learning milestones, Indicator 4.a.1 (Inclusive and safe schools) by equipping kids with skills in self awareness and empathy and Indicator 4.c.1 (supply of qualified teachers) by equipping teachers with the data and skills to build social emotional learning within the classroom.

NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism:
Extraction: We can broadly extract non-PII data during two instances a) during sign-up: where we capture the age and gender of the player and b) during the game play: here we capture different inputs the player provides like their emotional check-in, the different answers they log in, completion rates, user ratings. 

Importing and storage: The data is anonymized and stored on our internally built analytics dashboard. Currently the data is only utilized for two purposes a) internal quality assurance where we view metrics around user engagement and completion and b) to personalize the strategies recommended to a player based on their past ratings of strategies

openStandards:
Our solution adheres to the following open standards:

Security:
HTTPS - Our website uses HTTPS for secure communication over TLS 1.2 as per RFC 8446

Web Standards:
HTML5 - Our frontend markup adheres to HTML5 standards verified via https://validator.w3.org/

CSS3 - Our styling follows CSS3 standards verified via https://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/

Data Formats:
JSON - We use JSON for data exchange as per RFC 8259 
CSV - Structured data is stored in CSV format per RFC 4180


By leveraging open standards in these areas
we build on established protocols and patterns for interoperability
scalability and maintenance of our solution.
bestPractices:
Software Development:
Agile Methodology - We follow agile principles like user stories

and frequent deliverables. User stories are defined and prioritized for development sprints.
Version Control - All code is managed through Git version control on GitHub per best practices. Branches

and pull requests track code changes.
Automated Testing - Tests cases are defined for each component and run on every code change to detect regressions and validate functionality.
Code Reviews - All code must pass peer review before being merged. This shares knowledge and improves quality.
Continuous Integration - GitHub Actions run tests and validation on every push to detect issues early. New versions are built and deployed automatically.
Continuous Deployment - New builds are deployed frequently and automatically to production once tests pass to accelerate delivery.


Architecture:
Loose Coupling - Components are logically separated to allow flexible scaling and improvement. Event-driven architecture decouples backend services.
REST APIs - Backend services expose REST APIs for structured communication as per industry standards.
Client-Server - Distinct client-server separation of concerns improves efficiency and scalability.
Horizontal Scaling - Stateless application design and use of Kubernetes allows easy horizontal scaling.
Cloud Native - Following cloud computing best practices around high availability

and infrastructure as code


Open source:
Good First Issues - We tag simpler issues as "Good First Issues" to help onboard new contributors to the project.
Complete Documentation - The repository contains a comprehensive README file explaining the project

and contribution guidelines.
Open Community - We foster an open community by discussing project updates and contributions on our GitHub discussions page.
Defined Workflows - Contribution workflows are defined through GitHub issues

and branch management.


Adherence is validated through extensive tests
and architecture auditing. By leveraging industry standards across software development
we create robust and evolving software. Community-driven development and public visibility help drive innovation and accountability.

dataPrivacySecurity.dataPrivacySecurity:
To ensure privacy, security and integrity of user data, our project utilizes the following measures:
Cloud Infrastructure: We have deployed our services on Amazon Web Services (AWS) which provides a reliable and secure cloud infrastructure. AWS utilizes state-of-the-art data centers, hardware and networking to protect infrastructure.
Access Controls: User data can only be accessed by authenticated users within our organization. We maintain strict access controls to limit data access to the minimum required. Multi-factor authentication is enforced for sensitive data access.
Minimal Data Collection: We only collect the minimum user data required for our stated purposes. Users explicitly consent to any data collected.
No Third Party Sharing: We do not share or sell any user data with third parties without explicit consent. Even within our organization, data access is limited to only authorized personnel on an as-needed basis for a limited time.

With this multilayered approach to security and minimal data collection, we aim to fully safeguard the privacy, confidentiality and integrity of user data in our project. 

Privacy Policy: https://tillioss.github.io/docs/Privacy-Policy
